description: Music video directed by Takayuki Hirao for the song Mado wo Akete by CIEL. This track is also used as the ending song for the Eiga Daisuki Pompo-san film.

title.native: 映画大好きポンポさん

name.native: ジョエル・ポンポネット
alternative: ジョエル・ダヴィドヴィッチ・ポンポネット

node.description:
[Twitter](https://x.com/hira0takayuk1)

He graduated from Osaka's Designer College and started his career at [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) as a production assistant, later making the transition to storyboarder and episode director with [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/). During his time at Madhouse he served as Assistant Director to [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/Satoshi-Kon) on [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/Paranoia-Agent/) and was greatly influenced by him, regarding him as his mentor. Shortly after leaving Madhouse he joined [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable), where he worked for several years and made his proper directorial debut with [Kara no Kyoukai 5](https://anilist.co/anime/4282/). 

He left Ufotable in 2016 and he's been freelance since, returning to the company only to direct the opening for the video game Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey. 

Him and [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/) are really close friends since their days at Madhouse. They run a column called *Bariuta no ai wo shiritai!!* published in the Animage monthly magazine. 

He is married to color designer [Emi Chiba](https://anilist.co/staff/103075/).

[Profile (Kamitsubaki)](https://kamitsubaki.jp/artist/ciel/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRvkXFtB70ZADg4L6A8L3wQ) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CIEL_VanillaSky)

**CIEL** is a Japanese Artist mixing virtual and real who is signed under the label KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO.

Her character designer is [shirone](https://twitter.com/coxo_ii).

**[Website (Kamitsubaki)](https://kanzakiiori.kamitsubaki.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kurogaki0311) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kurogaki0311) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv1KOiaRusvqOR4BrT9Sh8w) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@iori_kanzaki)**

__Introduction:__
__Iori Kanzaki__ is a Japanese Vocaloid producer, singer-songwriter and vocalist.

__Biography:__
In January 2014, he made his debut in Vocaloid-P by posting "[Hankouki](https://youtu.be/nYcSlZKyAD0)".
In 2017, the song "[Inochi ni Kiwarete iru.](https://youtu.be/0HYm60Mjm0k)" was released and has since garnered an impressive 24 million plays as of 2023.
Responsible for writing, composing and arranging all the original songs of the virtual singer "[KAF](https://anilist.co/staff/168254)".
April 2019 saw the release of his first album, "Hakushi," which featured a collection of his popular tracks.
In February 2020, he unveiled a special box set that seamlessly merged his passion for storytelling with his musical talents. This unique release included the first full-length novel, "Beast," along with the EP "[Life is Comedy](https://youtu.be/t-Ux4ccMCGE)."
In September 2020, "Ano Natsu ga Houwa Suru.", a substantially revised edition of the long novel "Beast" initially launched in February, was released by Kawade Shobo.
In June 2021, he ventured into full-scale self-vocals.
Following his first one-man live performance, the release of his second album, "Clumsy Man," followed suit.
The BOX edition of this release also included his new novel, "Shin'ai Naru Anata e," which was published in November 2021 by Kawade Shobo.
A manga adaptation, titled "[Ano Natsu ga Houwa Suru.](https://anilist.co/manga/159516)", based on his first novel of the same name, commenced serialization in August 2022.
In May 2023, after graduating from Kamitsubaki Studio, he launched his own label, Ikuru Shelf, to kickstart his activities.

**[Website (Kamitsubaki)](https://kanzakiiori.kamitsubaki.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kurogaki0311) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kurogaki0311) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv1KOiaRusvqOR4BrT9Sh8w) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@iori_kanzaki)**

He graduated from Osaka's Designer College and started his career at [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) as a production assistant, later making the transition to storyboarder and episode director with [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/). He left Ufotable in 2016 and he's been freelance since, returning to the company only to direct the opening for the video game Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey. 

Him and [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/) are really close friends since their days at Madhouse. They run a column called *Bariuta no ai wo shiritai!!* published in the Animage monthly magazine. 

He is married to color designer [Emi Chiba](https://anilist.co/staff/103075/).
